shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 2ra-52vb) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 2ra-4rb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 5ra-16rb) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 5ra-10ra) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 10ra-16rb) I-3) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 15 miracles (fols. 16rb-52vb), incomplete [continuation of the text is in AMM-006]
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The name of the original female donor has been erased throughout the Ms. Only the name of the donor's father, ʾAmdä Maryam, has been preserved (fols. 19rb, 30va). Their names were partly replaced with those of Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʿAmätä Dǝngǝl in strong amaranth ink (e.g., fols. 5ra, 19ra, 23ra, 29ra, 37va, 40rb; s. also Additio 1), occasionally with that of Haftä (sic) Gäbrǝʾel and Wälättä Mädḫǝn in strong vermillion and black ink (e.g, fols. 19ra, 23rb, 30va, 41rb; s. also Additio 1).

dcomments.dcomment: Mid-18th - early 19th cent. (?) Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus might be identified with Ḫagos (d. 1831), the second son of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831) whose baptismal name was Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus. The identification is based on Additiones 1 and 2 in Ms. FBM-002.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. contains the beginning of the text continued in AMM-006, with no loss of text in between. The sewing has been repaired. Many fols. are affected by humidity, occasionally blurred ink. 1/3 of fol. 1 are cut off.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of some quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid scarlet, strong amaranth, strong vermillion).

squires.squire: I(4; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 4, stub after 1/fols. 1r-4v) – II(8/fol. 5r-12v) – III(8/fols. 13r-20v) – IV (8/fols. 21r-28v) – V(8/fols. 29-36v) – VI(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VII(8/fols. 45r-52v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting tend to left-sloping; it appears very irregular due to the variations in ruling (the size of the columns and the space between lines often differs significantly: e.g., fols. 15ra, 23r, 28r, 35rb), changes of the pen nib (slender or broad nib: e.g. fol. 1vab), changes in letters' height and varying spaces between the letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Rubrication of the main text is executed in vivid red. Nomina sacra; original names of the donors (mostly erased); incipit of Text I-1; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-2, incipit of its sections and subsections; incipit of Text I-3 and its sections (fols. 16ra, 19rb, 22ra, 23rb, 29rb, 30va, 34vb, 37va, 39ra, 40rb, 41rb, 42va, 44ra, 49ra, 51ra) and of a subsection (fol. 26va); word ʾǝsäggǝd, "I worship"; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Names of other donors, added (later) in a secondary hand, are written in strong amaranth and strong vermillion.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The end of the Ms. was photographed separately and given the signature AMM-006 as the codex has been preserved as two separate units. The entire Ms. comprised 160 fols. with 49 (?) miracles of Jesus.

additional.det: The note is crudely written and hardly legible because the ink has faded away. Haftä [sic] Gäbrǝʾel with his father Wäldä Giworgis [sic] and his mother Wälättä Maryam are mentioned in the lower part of the note. The upper part has been filled in by another secondary hand, in strong amaranth ink, with the names of Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʿAmätä Dǝngǝl. Furthermore a tabot (church) called Śǝllase ʾAyga is mentioned. It is possible that the same hand wrote Additio 2 in Ms. AMM-001 and Additio 3 in Ms. AMM-004. Both Mss. were donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus.

extras.extra: - The name(s) of the original donor(s), mentioned throughout the Ms., have been erased and partly replaced with other names in a different hand. - Omissiones written interlineally or in the margins: e.g., fols. 6ra, 16ra, 20r, 50ra. - Musical notation on fol. 45rb (?). - Corrections made in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 6ra, 15ra, 45r, 52vb. - Most of the erasures marked with parallel lines: e.g., fols. 8ra, 23rb, 34vb, 37va. - Crude letters: fol. 4r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the days of the week indicating the readings in Text I-1, in pen: fols. 2v, 3rv.
